subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: just joined - where do i start?
msgSnippet: I will apply to the letters group.  Maybe someone will have time to occasionally write back. Rick
messageBody:
I will apply to the letters group. Maybe someone will have time to
occasionally write back.

Rick

Moira O'Brien wrote:
>
>
> Welcome back Rick. The list has been a bit quiet recently as has our
> sister list - read_alphabet_letters which was set up to encourage people
> to practice their writing skills. Everyone seems to be too busy these
> days. Hopefully the list will come to life again soon.
>
> regards
>
> Moira
>
> On 03/03/2008, *Risk* <ra1@... <mailto:ra1@...>> wrote:
>
> Greetings from Texas!
>
> I have been reading Peter's Alice in Wonderland this last week. It is
> a wonderful way to learn the alphabet. Many thanks for making it
> available.
>
> I have been absent from the Shavian and Quickscript lists for several
> years now, doing this and that. Back then I was more interested in
> Shavian, but have come back to learn Quickscript again.
>
> Looking forward to becoming comfortable with it all again.
>
> Rick
>
> --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
> <mailto:Read_Alphabet%40yahoogroups.com>, "peter_r_guinness"
> <malt99@...>
> wrote:
> >
> > --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
> <mailto:Read_Alphabet%40yahoogroups.com>, "B.C. Siegl" <bcsiegl@> wrote:
> > >
> > > Hi, I just joined the group and am interested in learning QS. Where
> > do i
> > > start?
> > > Thanks in advance.
> > > BcS
> > >
> >
> > You could try my Alice-in-Wonderland tutorials here:
> >
> http://members.optusnet.com.au/~malt99/project_quickscript_website/inde
> <http://members.optusnet.com.au/%7Emalt99/project_quickscript_website/inde>
> > x.html
> > But please note that the tutorials use the General Australian accent
> > (eg: they drop the rhotic R so that it is quicker and easier for
> > Australians to learn).
> >
>
>
>
>
